attributes.action: A second EU Referendum, to enable a fully informed decision.
attributes.additional_details:
Significantly, "Leave" provided neither a post-Referendum plan nor a Risk assessment.
£350 million a week available for the NHS - FALSE.
Free entry to the Single Market - FALSE. 
No risk of the UK breaking up - FALSE
"Taking back control" - FALSE.  Impossible when much key UK infrastructure (energy, rail, etc) is foreign-owned. "Leave" made no mention of this.
attributes.background:
Key claims made before the Referendum are now being proved false. 

Under UK consumer legislation, citizens would have redress and a "cooling-off" period if companies had been involved in such flagrant miss-selling. The future of our country demands equivalent safeguards.
